column4: I'm trying to remove my gnome top panel; a link on ubuntu forums says I may be able to to it in "session options," but "session options" does not appear to be an available preference anymore (jaunty). help?
You should be able to right click on the top panel and choose to delete it.
I just tried it on mine and it is also grayed out, can I ask why you want to delelte it?
I don't know than, sorry, on mine I deleted the bottom panel and moved the one from the top to the bottom and added stuff to it, you could try to hide the panel, but that is my best guess.
